original_solution_mapping.L1: We know she counted 24 red jelly beans and 18 white jelly beans so 24 + 18 = <<24+18=42>>42 jelly beans
original_solution_mapping.L2: Even though she only bought 1 bag of jellybeans, she thought it would take 3 bags to fill up the bowl. So 3 bags * 42 jellybeans = <<1*42+1*42+1*42=126>>126 total red & white jellybeans

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7107.
    Returns: Jessica's guess as to how many red and white jelly beans were in the fishbowl.
    """
    # L1
    red_jellybeans = 24 # 24 red
    white_jellybeans = 18 # 18 white
    red_white_per_bag = red_jellybeans + white_jellybeans

    # L2
    num_bags_to_fill_bowl = 3 # three bags of jelly beans
    total_red_white_jellybeans = num_bags_to_fill_bowl * red_white_per_bag

    # FA
    answer = total_red_white_jellybeans
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: We know she counted {red_jellybeans} red jelly beans and {white_jellybeans} white jelly beans so {red_jellybeans} + {white_jellybeans} = <<{red_jellybeans}+{white_jellybeans}={red_white_per_bag}>>{red_white_per_bag} jelly beans

Even though she only bought 1 bag of jellybeans, she thought it would take {num_bags_to_fill_bowl} bags to fill up the bowl. So {num_bags_to_fill_bowl} bags * {red_white_per_bag} jellybeans = <<1*{red_white_per_bag}+1*{red_white_per_bag}+1*{red_white_per_bag}={total_red_white_jellybeans}>>{total_red_white_jellybeans} total red & white jellybeans

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: We know she counted 24 red jelly beans and 18 white jelly beans so 24 + 18 = <<24+18=42>>42 jelly beans
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Even though she only bought 1 bag of jellybeans, she thought it would take 18 bags to fill up the bowl. So 18 bags * 42 jellybeans = <<1*42+1*42+1*42=756>>756 total red & white jellybeans

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'white_jellybeans' (18) was used instead of 'num_bags_to_fill_bowl' (3).
